manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: Education Solar Robot Toys Help To Develop Manual Dexterity, Problem Solving Skills, Improve Logical Thinking, Self-Confidence Teamwork & Collaboration.

POWER BY THE SUN, NO BATTERY This stem building toys is powered by the sun and no batteries required. The robot kit includes a solar power panel that collects solar heat energy into an electric energy drive motor, which drives the gears to make the machine run smoothly, The robot can crawl, roll and float under the direct sunshine. MORE FUN AND CHALLENGING Our robot kit can be assembled into 13 different types of robots. Moving on land or water, from easy to complicated level, provide endless fun for kids, developing problem solving, self-confidence. Solar robot kit is ideal present for birthday, Halloween, Christmas, Easter, STEM, summer camp activities, school activities. EDUCATION AND CHALLENGE This is a great way for your child to get started in robotics. After they amuse themselves with the entry level, can challenge their manipulative skills with second level; Besides, this solar robot kit will teach childs and students how to engineer a robot that uses solar power, while challenging manual dexterity, and developing problem solving, self-confidence.

reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Defenitely for 11 years and up.
reviews.reviewText: These are pretty involved. But it is not meant for younger children, unless you plan on doing all of the work. For the price, it's a great little set that helps create positive creativity. It also helps with following directions to achieve an outcome. Again, perfectly find for 11/12 years old and up. Most people will build it 1x at one of the 13 different creations and keep it at that.

reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Regalar a otros niños

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 8, 2024
reviews.reviewText: My grandson loves to build things! He was super excited to get this for Christmas

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 9, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 1.0 out of 5 stars Solar panel not working and gears get stuck
reviews.reviewText: I just gave this robot to my son, he is very handy and assembles 1000 piece construction toys with no problem. However, he has built multiple versions of this robot and the gears spin but get stuck. The solar power panel does not work at all, we have charged it for several hours and still unresponsive. Although we just started assembling it, I purchased it 2 months ago so I missed the return window but this is an incredible waste of time, money and my son is very disappointed on his birthday gift as is failing in multiple areas. I do not recommend this robot

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 22, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Solar Robotic Kit.
reviews.reviewText: I bought it as a gift for Christmas for my grandson, I like what I saw ,and the different solar robots he can build. I know he will enjoy this alot.Im happy with this purchase .

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 6, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars Not for an 11 year old
reviews.reviewText: The directions were awful. My 11 year old grandson who puts Legos together couldn’t do this. My daughter had to help him and use directions on you tube to get the motor part and ended up breaking a piece for solar part trying to get it off frame thing. Not recommended for a kid
